name: Matthias Lanzinger
content: Matthias Lanzinger Skip to Content Top-level Navigation: Staff Education research Contact Services Current-level Navigation: Path: DBAI > staff > Matthias Lanzinger Tools: Drucken Matthias Lanzinger TISS:Matthias Lanzinger Room: HD0305 Phone:+43/1/58801/1922-16 Fax:+43/1/58801/18493 Email: I am currently an Assistent Professor (Tenure Track) for Database Theory at the Databases and Aritificial Intelligence Group. I obtained my PhD from TU Wien in 2021 and afterwards worked as a Senior Research Assoicate at the University of Oxford until the end of 2023. Interests I am currently interested in hypergraph decompositions and (fixed-parameter) tractable fragments of conjunctive queries as well as the theory of Machine Learning on graphs. My general fields of interest include (parameterized) computational complexity, database theory, and discrete mathematics. Teaching 181.140 VU Database Theory (See also the course website) 184.780 VU Advanced Database Systems Thesis Supervision I am currently seeking students for supervision in the following areas: Bachelor's Thesis Master's Thesis If you're interested in conducting research under my guidance, please don't hesitate to contact me for more information. Publications Please refer to DBLP or Google Scholar for up-to-date lists of publications.
